content.description: Starting with a high crimp on the face, move left and continue up the arete on the left end of Comic Cliff through a fun series of 4-5 moves before finding the jug. Finish the top out with easy climbing. Surprisingly fun & worth it for its short length.
content.protection: Possible to set up a TR with hand- to finger-sized gear and a cordellete.
content.location: Start on the fractured face directly beneath the flared crack that emerges halfway up the climb. Walk off.

content.description: Tough face climb to a crack. The crux is just getting off the ground. Once you have the face holds, go for the crack. Get pro in quickly, the fall could hurt.Walk off on climber’s left side of the crag.  A TR can be set up with 60-100ft static line
content.location: The first obvious crack line from the far left edge of the wall.

content.description:
Good hand holds up the ramp, leading to a crack and then a face climb over the top.  Crux comes at the top of the ramp once you have moved out onto the face since down climbing is very difficult and climbing over the bulge requires strong hands.  Potential for injury exists if you fall, and getting pro in is a difficult proposition. 

  You can traverse right along a seam and exit out of a crack to the right, still 5.8 just playing to crack strengths versus face climbing.
content.protection: Guide book recommends top rope.  Would need medium to large cams to protect.
content.location: Just before Thor's Wall, at the right end of Comic Cliff.  An obvious ramp to the right of a wide crack.

content.description: Make a couple tricky face moves with poor protection to a good crack with lots of features and some good jamming.
content.protection: BD .5-#2A TR can be set up with a 100 ft static line
content.location: Starts as a single crack towards the bottom and splits into two towards the top.  Second crack from the left side of the crag.

content.description: Face climb straight up the middle of the large detached flake and then finish up the slab. - same finish as Ramp it Up
content.protection: 100 ft static line for TR anchor.  The face is crossed by shallow seams not deep enough for good gear.
content.location: Located on the large flake on the right side of Comic Cliff

content.description: Tricky face moves past a horizonatal
content.protection: 100 ft static line for TR.  unprotect-able until the horizontal
content.location: The face on the left side of Comic cliff.

content.description: A short, shallow,  but fun route following a crack from thin hands to fists (Smaller hands will find it to be OW territory).  Stem the slicker start to good jams above.
content.protection: BD .5 -#4.   TR needs a long static line in order to sling boulders further back.   Walk off L over comic cliff or R. To the 4th class chimney between Comic Cliff and Thor’s wall.
content.location: A dark, water streaked crack Located on the right side of Comic cliff in a corner behind a small Bush.

content.description: North facing aspect gives some shade, along with medium sized trees.These are very short steep routes, with tough moves. Routes can be led or a top rope can be set up with a 100 ft static line and slung boulders.
